key.name: org.pentaho.reporting.engine.classic.core.modules.output.pageable.graphics.AlphaChannel
key.description: Defines, whether the alpha channel should be enabled for the image encoding in the process-task.

key.name: org.pentaho.reporting.engine.classic.core.modules.output.pageable.graphics.DeviceResolution
key.description:
Defines in which resolution the generated images should be printed. If the image is not available in a suitable size for the given layouted output size, the image will be scaled to fit the specified device resolution.
For the sake of backward compatitibility, we define the device resolution to be 96 DPI. This way, a pixel equals a point in the rendering.

key.name: org.pentaho.reporting.engine.classic.core.modules.output.pageable.graphics.EncoderMime
key.description: Defines the encoder to use when exporting images in the process-task.

key.name: org.pentaho.reporting.engine.classic.core.modules.output.pageable.graphics.Module
key.description: A module definition. Please do not edit this entry.

key.name: org.pentaho.reporting.engine.classic.core.modules.output.pageable.graphics.Quality
key.description: Defines the encoding quality when encoding JPEGs in the process-task.

key.name: org.pentaho.reporting.engine.classic.core.modules.output.pageable.graphics.UseNativeScaling
key.description:
Defines, whether scaling should use the device's native scaling, which may or may not produce sensible results, or whether the images should be prescaled using a internal image scaling algorithm.
This defaults to "false" so that we can guarantee the same output quality in all cases.

key.name: org.pentaho.reporting.engine.classic.core.modules.output.pageable.graphics.WatermarkPrinted
key.description: Defines, whether the Watermarks-Section will be evaluated by the Graphics2D output processor. This defaults to true.

key.name: org.pentaho.reporting.engine.classic.core.modules.output.pageable.graphics.debug.OutlineMode
key.description: Defines that the Graphics2D and PDF output will ignore the regular border and background definitions. The output target will draw debugging borders instead, which can be used to visualize the internal structure of the output. Unless you want to debug the report layouter, there is no need to enable this property.

key.name: org.pentaho.reporting.engine.classic.core.modules.output.pageable.graphics.debug.PrintPageContents
key.description: Defines, that the output target will dump the currently processed page to the log system. This is expensive and creates huge amounts of data. It only makes sense to activate this property, if you are debugging the report layout system. For everyone else, activating this property will result in a enormous slow-down.
